He goes on to say, "Look, it's New York City. They're all Democrats. It's 
already a liberal place.  They are ALL pretty liberal"??? Is this 
commentator aware that New York had not had a Democrat as Mayor in 20 years?
I turned him off at 0:41.﻿

comments.text:

the beliefs and attitudes of the general population. New York is still a 
relatively liberal and progressive place (at least socially and culturally) 
despite having Conservative mayors for the past 20 years . It's like, for 
example, how when Nixon and republicans were in power in the late 60s-mid 
70s, the US nontheless was undergoing a lot of liberal social and cultural 
change at the same time (the new permissiveness in movies and tv, the 
sexual revolution, black power, feminist movement, environmental movement, 
etc, etc)

comments.author: MXxOxXM

comments.text:
+MXxOxXM No, because it's possible to reclaim words and language; it is 
possible to change culture around the words being used. Changing words and 
words alone is just window-dressing, nothing more. People say 
African-American instead of a more offensive term, but they still mean 
exactly the same thing. Language is a reflection of culture; the Sapr-Whorf 
hypothesis has been completely disproven.

You used the whole calling his kids white thing but it's just employing 
bullshit reformist liberal colorblindness which just reinforces structural 
inequality by ignoring the circumstances that people of African heritage 
face in the US.
comments.author: TheJayfa

comments.text:
+TheJayfa
Look, we are both on the same side here but if racist *language* is part of 
racism then why wouldn't changing the way the language is used be part of 
the solution (perhaps not the biggest part but part nonetheless)? Language 
does matter. You say we need to change the culture, and I agree, is not 
language part of culture? I used the whole calling his kids white thing to 
illuminate my point yet you've taken it out of context. 
#readingcomprehension
comments.author: MXxOxXM

comments.text:
I agree with what you are saying but if the police were racially profiling 
his son, they would be profiling him on the basis that he is black (i.e. he 
has brown skin.)

They *might* profile him based on being mixed-race... I suppose. But 
wouldn't that shift the game back to a mulatto-era?

The point in fact is that his kid and his wife have brown skin. Being 
colorblind to race or bowdlerizing language isn't going to stop the racism. 
We need to change culture, not words.
comments.author: TheJayfa

comments.text:
+Joe E Dangerously
Cool story bro (not). So then why not call them white: 'DiBlasio's black 
wife and white kids,' if the label used doesn't matter so much? Here's why 
not, because the whole issue is steeped in historical racism (didn't you 
read what I wrote about the one-drop rule?). I'm sorry you can't understand 
that. I didn't make racism, it exists. Don't hate the player, hate the game 
and language matters.
comments.author: MXxOxXM

comments.text:
Oh for Christ's sake. They're black. Just like Obama is black. It's 
shorthand. not dishonesty. I'm racially mixed too. I'm half middle eastern 
Greek and half white. I call myself a Greek and an Anatoli. I'm not being 
dishonest when I don't specify that I'm bi-racial every time I mention it 
even though I very much am. Chill out. No one's racist here. It's just 
shorthand. That's all. It's fine to call Obama black, it's fine to call 
Dante De Blasio black, and it's fine to call me brown/olive. Half my family 
looks like Cenk and half look like De Blasio. I'm not disrespecting either 
side by not specifying every little detail. I know many other 
racially-mixed people, including a fair number of half-black people and all 
of them call themselves black. Every last one.
comments.author: Joe E Dangerously

comments.text:
Yes we are all mishpcha, MXxOxXM, and maybe even more than we want to 
admit. My 'causasian' Polish wife appears to be of Jewish and Roma 
extraction, and so are my children by the drop-of-blood rule. For the other 
50% they are Dutch. So who is a 'pure' white citizen? I have no idea.

This is probably why religious people - Jews, muslims, christians - tend to 
marry within their community. They do so for fear of mixing their genes 
with other representatives of the homo sapiens with a different opinion 
about god. That is: for fear of breaking the drop-of-blood rule.

The second best option is if their men marry a woman from another race, 
tribe, or social class. That woman is supposed to obey to their men and his 
family, give up her previous identity, and convert "voluntarily" to their 
husband's religion. It is hardly ever the other way around: that Jewish or 
muslim women are allowed to marry non-Jews or non-muslims, and that their 
husbands convert to their religion. The sexist drop-of-blood can only 
change in one direction.

In sum, children from mixed marriages can be called bi-racial and we can 
consider them and their parents from a general mishpocha; but parts of the 
mishpocha want to distinguish between people from different religions and 
use male chauvinism to keep religions and blood 'pure'.
